pullRequest.body:
The proof of:
```
Tendsto (fun s : ‚Ñù ‚Ü¶ (s - 1) * ‚àë' (n : ‚Ñï), 1 / (n : ‚Ñù) ^ s) (ùìù[>] 1) (ùìù 1)
```
using the existing result for the complex variable. 

This PR is part of the proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [2bae09e2d9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18166/commits/2bae09e2d9230cfaaa691b19070f3556cf262112)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ tendsto_sub_mul_tsum_nat_cpow`
`+ tendsto_sub_mul_tsum_nat_rpow`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Your new lemma differs from the existing one in two ways -- firstly you write out the zeta function as a tsum, and secondly you take the limit over reals. How about "splitting the difference" and proving both versions? We could add
```lean
/-- The residue of `Œ∂(s)` at `s = 1` is equal to 1, expressed using `tsum`. -/
theorem riemannZeta_residue_one' :
    Tendsto (fun s : ‚ÑÇ ‚Ü¶ (s - 1) * ‚àë' (n : ‚Ñï), 1 / (n : ‚ÑÇ) ^ s) (ùìù[{s | 1 < re s}] 1) (ùìù 1) := by
  refine (tendsto_nhdsWithin_mono_left ?_ riemannZeta_residue_one).congr' ?_
  ¬∑ simp only [subset_compl_singleton_iff, mem_setOf_eq, one_re, not_lt, le_refl]
  ¬∑ filter_upwards [eventually_mem_nhdsWithin] with s hs using
      congr_arg _ <| zeta_eq_tsum_one_div_nat_cpow hs
```
and then deduce your original formulation via
```lean
/-- The residue of `Œ∂(s)` at `s = 1` is equal to 1 expressed using `tsum` and for a
real variable. -/
theorem riemannZeta_residue_one'' :
    Tendsto (fun s : ‚Ñù ‚Ü¶ (s - 1) * ‚àë' (n : ‚Ñï), 1 / (n : ‚Ñù) ^ s) (ùìù[>] 1) (ùìù 1) := by
  rw [‚Üê tendsto_ofReal_iff, ofReal_one]
  have : Tendsto (fun s : ‚Ñù ‚Ü¶ (s : ‚ÑÇ)) (ùìù[>] 1) (ùìù[{s | 1 < re s}] 1) :=
    continuous_ofReal.continuousWithinAt.tendsto_nhdsWithin (fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ by aesop)
  apply (riemannZeta_residue_one'.comp this).congr fun s ‚Ü¶ ?_
  simp only [Function.comp_apply, ofReal_mul, ofReal_sub, ofReal_one, ofReal_tsum,
    ofReal_inv, ofReal_cpow (Nat.cast_nonneg _), ofReal_natCast]
```
The combination is of course a little longer than your original proof (and the lemmas need better names!) but I think it's worthwhile to make the intermediate step available. What do you think?
I think it's a great idea. I'll do that. Thanks for the quick review!

I'm happy with the code now but I'd rather the lemmas had more informative names (particularly since neither of them actually mentions `riemannZeta`). Perhaps we can go for `tendsto_sub_mul_tsum_nat_cpow_nhdsWithin` and `tendsto_sub_mul_tsum_nat_rpow_nhdsWithin`?

> I'm happy with the code now but I'd rather the lemmas had more informative names (particularly since neither of them actually mentions `riemannZeta`). Perhaps we can go for `tendsto_sub_mul_tsum_nat_cpow_nhdsWithin` and `tendsto_sub_mul_tsum_nat_rpow_nhdsWithin`?

There might be a bit long though. What about dropping the `nhdsWithin`?

> There might be a bit long though. What about dropping the `nhdsWithin`?

Sure, happy with that.

> > There might be a bit long though. What about dropping the `nhdsWithin`?
> 
> Sure, happy with that.

Ok. I changed the names.

Excellent, let's send this on.

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11531582442/job/32102443720)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11531582442/job/32102443681)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LSeries/RiemannZeta): versions of the residue computation of the zeta function with tsum and for a real variable

source.title: feat(NumberTheory/NumberField): proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula

nodes.body:
Your new lemma differs from the existing one in two ways -- firstly you write out the zeta function as a tsum, and secondly you take the limit over reals. How about "splitting the difference" and proving both versions? We could add
```lean
/-- The residue of `Œ∂(s)` at `s = 1` is equal to 1, expressed using `tsum`. -/
theorem riemannZeta_residue_one' :
    Tendsto (fun s : ‚ÑÇ ‚Ü¶ (s - 1) * ‚àë' (n : ‚Ñï), 1 / (n : ‚ÑÇ) ^ s) (ùìù[{s | 1 < re s}] 1) (ùìù 1) := by

  ¬∑ filter_upwards [eventually_mem_nhdsWithin] with s hs using
      congr_arg _ <| zeta_eq_tsum_one_div_nat_cpow hs
```
and then deduce your original formulation via
```lean
/-- The residue of `Œ∂(s)` at `s = 1` is equal to 1 expressed using `tsum` and for a
real variable. -/
theorem riemannZeta_residue_one'' :
    Tendsto (fun s : ‚Ñù ‚Ü¶ (s - 1) * ‚àë' (n : ‚Ñï), 1 / (n : ‚Ñù) ^ s) (ùìù[>] 1) (ùìù 1) := by
  rw [‚Üê tendsto_ofReal_iff, ofReal_one]
  have : Tendsto (fun s : ‚Ñù ‚Ü¶ (s : ‚ÑÇ)) (ùìù[>] 1) (ùìù[{s | 1 < re s}] 1) :=
    continuous_ofReal.continuousWithinAt.tendsto_nhdsWithin (fun _ _ ‚Ü¶ by aesop)
  apply (riemannZeta_residue_one'.comp this).congr fun s ‚Ü¶ ?_
  simp only [Function.comp_apply, ofReal_mul, ofReal_sub, ofReal_one, ofReal_tsum,
    ofReal_inv, ofReal_cpow (Nat.cast_nonneg _), ofReal_natCast]
```
The combination is of course a little longer than your original proof (and the lemmas need better names!) but I think it's worthwhile to make the intermediate step available. What do you think?
